item.title: When you want to adjust the axis scale interval with APLpy
item.description: Note that I was a little addicted to the method of adjusting the axis scale interval with APLpy. For example, if you want to adjust the display interval of the main scale on the x-axis, fig.ticks.set_xspacing(0.0005) You can do it. However, the argument here must be a multiple of the minimum unit of label format. Now fig.ticklabels.set_xformat(hh:mm:ss.ss) If so, the minimum unit is 0.001s or 0.015 arcsec, and therefore 0.
